column4: hey guys, what makes a fresh install of 10.04 not list windows networks when i go to the Network tab?
network tab where?
Places -> Network -> Windows Network
please note that default ubuntu install is not compatible with Vista, 7 and Server 200
so how can i be able to see the shared folders from my windows machines?
no, like i said, when i go to 'Windows Network' it doesnt list any of my windows machines
i want to access my windows shared folders from my 10.04, not the other way around
where is that?!
i dont really get it.. with 9.10 my windows machines used to show fine under Place/Network/Windows Network
hm strange
can you connect to them providing IP address directly?
i know how to do that in a windows machine.. how can i do that in ubuntu?
open nautilus and type in Location bar smb://<IP address>
i cant type anything in the Location bar
why?
there is no bar to type in.. it just shows the filesystem and the home folder
press Ctrl+L or click the little pencil icon
yes, i can connect that way
used windows user/pass as well
i didnt set it to master and i dont see that option there
it should be there, set it up
do i have to do anything after changing settings in smb.conf?
if you have samba demon running, restart it and wait about 15 minutes
